content: We'll use this topic for official announcements re: Argonaut 2020 Granular Scopes project.
Cross-post for visibility: this channel has details for today's Argonaut Kick-off call (3p ET)
Update: this call has been moved to https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/6855905105082259725 (same time == 3p ET today)

Cross posting email message we sent to folks who mentioned interest in Granular Controls!

You're receiving this email because you or a colleague indicated your interest in participating in the Argonaut 2020 Granular Controls work group. Going forward, notifications related to this work group will be posted on the SMART Zulip channel instead of through email, so please be sure to subscribe at https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179170-smart/topic/Argonaut.20Announcements .

To help determine the scope of the project, please complete the Granular Controls Survey before March 26th. If you weren't able to attend the kickoff meeting on Wednesday, a recording has been posted at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h18HjsPk6Rc and provides context for this survey.

Our first working group meeting will take place on April 1nd at 2pm ET - details are at http://2020.argo.run . Please feel free to reach out via email or on Zulip with any questions!
the survey link didn't work for me
Sorry John, I am wrestling 3 kids till 1, will update then.
@John Moehrke give it another try!
@Brett Marquard Are we meeting now? I don't see any connection details at 2020.argo.run. Only for Patient Lists.
Sorry, see it now at the bottom.

Join the meeting:

https://meet.jit.si/argo2020.granular

To join by phone instead, tap this: +1.512.402.2718,,661769782#

Looking for a different dial-in number?
See meeting dial-in numbers: https://meet.jit.si/static/dialInInfo.html?room=argo2020.granular
Welp, missed this since it never landed on my calendar. Is there a meeting series calendar invite we can download from somewhere?
Want to get the full series on my calendar to protect the time slot...
Yes there is a calendar for all the Argonaut projects at http://2020.argo.run
If it's helpful we could also publish calendars broken down by project.
...or if enough people want an outlook calendar invite I am happy to send. Just no promises all cancellations will work.

I've been playing around, it looks like I can't subscribe to block my calendar, but I can import to do it. So for now, I've imported the iCal and subscribed so I can pull up the 'master' if updates are made
We'll see if that works :)
Jenni, I'll send you my manually maintained outlook event. Itll put something on your calendar, but I might be slow to catch removals. Anybody else want it?
lol. IDCaaS. Isaac's Distributed Calendar as a Service

Hey Brett, I keep a calendar invite for this call that I share with Jenni (and anyone else that's interested -- let me know!). Will this call be permanently shifted a week forward? (Will we meet on July 1st and then again on the 8th?)
My original thought was we would call 7/1 an 'out of cycle' and resume on 7/8. But let's discuss on the call next week
Make sure I understand... We are moving this week to next week?
Correct.
no Granular Controls meeting today!
Coll thanks!

Call Details: https://meet.jit.si/argo2020.granular To join by phone instead, tap this: +1.512.402.2718,,661769782#
We seem to have missed a few folks today -- for anyone that wants to be added to the google calendar invite please send me a private chat with email and I will add you.

Going forward we will post in three places to try to catch everyone:

  • Zulip
  • Google calendar for those that want to be added
  • FHIR-I list serve

Hopefully this will get everyone!

Google calendar for those that want to be added

And to be clear, even if you don't want to be added to the calendar, you can still view it (details at http://2020.argo.run).
Quick reminder that we'r on for tomorrow's granular data call! 2p ET at https://meet.jit.si/argo2020.granular

Quick note that we're going to cancel this week's call ; we will pick up with our next regularly scheduled call on 8/5. In the meantime, I'd love feedback on the proposed Connectathon track at https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2020-09+Argonaut+Granular+Controls?src=contextnavpagetreemode

Note that we have a few PRs to talk through, listed in the draft agenda. If you have a chance to review ahead of time, that'd be lovely (and we'll provide an overview on the call too, of course).

This Friday 8/28 from 2-3 PM EDT the Argonaut team will provide a brief update on the active 2020 projects:

  • Bulk Data
  • Granular Controls
  • Patient Lists

We will also outline our goals for the upcoming Connectathon 9/9-9/11/2020.

Please join us if you can!

Join the meeting:
https://meet.jit.si/argo2020

Cheers!

Special out-of-sequence announcement! The SMARTv2 call is on for today (Wednesday, December 16th) at 2:00 PM ET. The first part of the call will be dedicated to the connectathon track intro.

  • Meeting link: https://meet.jit.si/argo2020.granular
  • Notes and Agenda: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PL0YIhe6IzTECXO9SkezSnk80b3R-KiEk4e0_GuaBhs/

Hope to see you all there, cheers!
For SMARTv2 Connectathon track, orientation call is at https://youtu.be/fKYb5nuPKDw (or will be as soon as YouTube finishes processing). It's also listed on the track overview page.

Happy New Year to everyone! The SMARTv2 call is on for tomorrow (Wednesday, January 6th) at 2:00 PM ET.

  • Meeting link: https://meet.jit.si/argo2020.granular
  • Notes and Agenda: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PL0YIhe6IzTECXO9SkezSnk80b3R-KiEk4e0_GuaBhs/

If you have any questions or items to add to the agenda, let us know. Cheers!

Thanks again to everyone who participated in the Connectathon! While I didn't get to spend as much time in the gathering space as I'd like, the track was productive and it was great to catch up with some others in distant time zones.

In fact, the Connectathon went so well that we feel we're in a good position to hand off SMARTv2 to the FHIR-I and Security WGs (e.g., the remaining open questions will need to be discussed in those groups regardless, and we have good direction for them).

So with that in mind, thanks to everyone who has participated over the past year to move this spec forward. We appreciate all of the time, effort, and expertise that has been brought to the project, as well as the communication with other humans during this crazy year =). The calendar will be updated shortly.

Cheers!
